bibl.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to James D. Porter
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: I have the honour to acknowledge the receipt of circular dated March 16, 1886, and in reply thereto beg to submit to you the following:

row.cell: On the total measurement overall, length breadth and depth, per Cubic Metre

div1.p:
On vessels constructed out of the port, 10% on the total cost of the vessel. This is intended to equalize the imports as constructors here have to pay duties on the
the materials imported and used in construction.
The Customs imports are as follow:

row.cell: Certificate that the vessel will not be employed in the slave trade

div1.p: The tonage for this import is calculated on the product of the measurement in the cubic metres, overall, divided by 3.24.
I may add that only small vessels, not exceeding 40 Tons are constructed here.

I have the honour to be,
Sir
Your Obedient Servant
Robt S. Newton
Vice Consul
div1.fw:
The Honble
James D Porter
Assistant Secretary
Washington D.C.
